document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Larnaca Walker, 1869 from China (Orthoptera: Gryllacrididae: Gryllacridinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types species:
Larnaca fasciata Walker, 1869

subSubSection.paragraph:
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) emarginata Bian, Guo & Shi, 2015
(
凹缘原Ṟ⁂ )
http://lsid.speciesfile.org/urn:lsid: Orthoptera .speciesfile.org:TaxonName: 470142

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2. Features of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) emarginata
. A. head; B. dorsal view of pronotum; C. lateral view of pronotum; D. left tegmen; E. right tegmen; F. left hind wing. A, B, D-F. female; C. male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) emarginata : Bian, Guo & Shi, 2015
. Zootaxa , 3994(2): 293; Du, Bian & Shi, 2017 . Zootaxa , 4231(4): 585; Cadena-Castañeda, 2019 . Zootaxa , 4605(1): 78; Bian, Liu & Yang, 2021 . Zootaxa , 4969(2): 225.

Type specimen:
male; Kind of type: holotype ; Type locality: Gaoligong Shan , Tengchong , Yunnan
; Location of type specimen: Museum of Hebei
University, Baoding, Hebei , China
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Abdominal apex of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) emarginata
. A. lateral view; B. ventral view; C. ovipositor; D. dorsal view. A–C. female; D. male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male. See
Bian et al. (2015)
.

Coloration. Body general black. Ocelli yellow. Scape, pedicel, and basal parts of flagellum black, other parts of flagellum brown. Clypeus with white spots. Pronotum black. Basal parts of tegmina black brown, outer parts yellowish brown. Legs with golden fluff; basal parts of femora crimson, hind tibiae milky except basal parts, other parts of legs black. Ovipositor reddish brown.

Measurements (mm). Body (from head to tip of abdomen): 24.24; pronotum: 5.01–5.20; tegmen: 3.21–3.59; hind wing: 1.91–1.94; fore femur: 6.75–6.85; median femur: 6.22–6.26; hind femur: 10.72–10.76; fore tibia: 7.75– 7.88; median tibia: 7.85.–7.95; hind tibia: 12.01–12.14; ovipositor: 8.12.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
1♀ 1♂ . China , Yunnan Province , Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture , Gasa Coun- ty, Dahei Mountain , ( 22°1'7"N , 100°41'5"E , Alt. 1580),
7-IV-2021
, coll. Ce Hui.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Yunnan , China (Lianghe, Longchuan, Tengchong, Yingjiang, Jinghong).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Body of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) emarginata
. A, B, E. female; C, D. male. A–D. living. E. dorsal view of specimen. Photograph: Ce Hui.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) walle
sp. nov. (
IJ力原Ṟ⁂ )

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
♂ , China , Yunnan Province , Dehong Dai and Jingpo Autonomous Prefecture , Yingjiang County , Xima Town . ( 24°46'40"N , 97°40'40"E , Alt. 1470),
2-VII-2021
, coll. Da-fu Nie.

subSubSection.paragraph: Fore coxa with a spine at fore margin ( Fig. 6C ); fore and mid femora unarmed ( Fig. 6 AB); fore and mid tibiae dorsally unarmed ( Fig. 6 AB); fore tibiae ventrally with 4 external and 3 internal spines and one pair of smaller spurs; mid tibiae ventrally with 3 pairs of spines and one pair of smaller spurs; hind femora ventrally with 4 external spinules; hind tibiae dorsally with 6 internal spinules, 5 external spinules and one pair of apical spurs, ventrally with one preapical spines and 2 apical spurs on both sides. External margin of hind femora with a long furrow ( Fig. 6E ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. Features of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) walle
sp. nov.
A. head; B. dorsal view of pronotum; C. lateral view of pronotum; D. left tegmen.

subSubSection.paragraph: Eighth abdominal tergite prolonged ( Fig. 7C ). Ninth abdominal tergite curved downwards, furrowed along midline into 2 lobes, apical area prolonged into a long spiniform process with finely granular surface which crossed and pointed inside ( Fig. 7 AC). Cerci slightly incurved ( Fig. 7 BC). Subgenital plate broader than long, anterior margin straight, posterior margin with an obviously V-shaped median incision ( Fig. 7B ); styli slightly curved and distinctly conical, inserted in posterior area of lateral margins of subgenital plate ( Fig. 7B ).
Female. Unknown.

Coloration. Body general blackish brown. Face general yellowish brown. Scape, pedicel, and basal parts of flagellum black, other parts of flagellum brown. Mandible and labrum black. Pronotum black. Tegmen semi-transparent with black veins. Legs with golden fluff; basal parts of fore and mid femora crimson, hind tibiae milky when alive, other parts of legs black. Abdomen general brown.

Measurements (mm). Body (from head to tip of abdomen): 20.73; pronotum: 4.95; tegmen: 13.03; hind wing: 13.24; fore femur: 6.42–6.46; median femur: 6.41–6.42; hind femur: 9.22–9.26; fore tibia: 6.72–6.78; median tibia: 6.99–7.05; hind tibia: 9.32–9.34.

Notes. This new species is similar to
Larnaca (Larnaca) emarginata
in the shape of apex of male abdomen, but can be easily distinguished from the latter by: the length of tegmina,
L. emarginta
is extremely short, while the new species is much longer; head of
L. emarginta
is general black with 2 yellow lateral ocelli and one enlarged ocellus, while head of the new species is yellowish brown with indistinct ocelli.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6. Legs of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) walle
sp. nov.
A. left fore leg; B. left mid leg; C, right fore coxa; D. apical spurs on hind tibia; E. furrow and spinules on hind femur.

FIGURE 7. Abdominal apex of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) walle
sp. nov.
A. rear view; B. ventral view; C. lateral view.

FIGURE 8. Body of holotype of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) walle
sp. nov.
A. living. B. dorsal view of specimen.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. This species is named after the title character of film WALL-E. In the film, rampant consumerism, corporate greed, and environmental neglect have turned planet Earth into a garbage-strewn wasteland in the 29th century. Robot WALL-E is a Waste Allocation Load Lifter of Earth, whose single task is to collect and compact garbage under sandstorm skies to restore the planet humanity has destroyed until his battered processors wind down. The film underlines the message that if we don’t take care of the only planet we inhabit, it won’t be able to support us.
Distribution. Yunnan , China (Yingjiang).

Larnaca ( Larnaca ) infolda Du, Bian & Shi, 2017
(
内叠原Ṟ⁂ ) http://lsid.speciesfile.org/urn:lsid: Orthoptera .speciesfile.org:TaxonName: 496382

Larnaca ( Larnaca ) infolda : Du, Bian & Shi, 2017
. Zootaxa , 4231(4): 585; Cadena-Castañeda, 2019 . Zootaxa , 4605(1): 78; Bian, Liu & Yang, 2021 . Zootaxa , 4969(2): 225.

Type specimen:
male; Kind of type: holotype ; Type locality: Mengla , Mengyuan , Yunnan
; Location of type specimen: Museum of Hebei
University, Baoding, Hebei , China
.

Notes.
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) squamiptera
Ingrisch, 2018
is described as a new species based on one female specimen from Thailand , according to the strongly reduced tegmen, and the distinct hieroglyphic pattern of black lines and dots on pronotum compared to other species. After checking the descriptions of
Larnaca ( Larnaca ) infolda
from China , we found the two species share all the same characteristics except the depth of the notch on posterior margin of female subgenital plate. More specimens from type locality of the two species need to be checked to determine its effectiveness.
Distribution. Yunnan , China (Jinghong, Mengla).
